intro: Microsisymbrium lasiophyllum var. rigidum, commonly known as the rigid leaf microsisymbrium, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive rigid, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
